intro: Cathestecum tamaulipense, commonly known as the Tamaulipan cathestecum, is a flowering plant native to the Tamaulipan region of Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to purple. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands and along riverbanks. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
